IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO FIND WAYS TO PREVENT AND CURE PULMONARY HYPERTENSION AND TO PROVIDE (CONTINUED ON SCHEDULE O ) HOPE FOR THE PULMONARY HYPERTENSION COMMUNITY THROUGH SUPPORT, EDUCATION, ADVOCACY, AND AWARENESS.
IRS990.MissionDesc: TO SEEK A CURE FOR PULMONARY HYPERTENSION AND TO PROVIDE HOPE FOR THE PULMONARY HYPERTENSION COMMUNITY THROUGH SUPPORT, EDUCATION, ADVOCACY, AND AWARENESS.
IRS990.Desc: PATIENT SERVICES AND EDUCATION; MEDICAL AWARENESS; EDUCATIONAL SUPPORT RESOURCES VIA PATIENT TELEPHONE HELPLINE; OVER 200 SUPPORT GROUPS, NEWSLETTERS, BROCHURES, AND A WEBSITE. PHA PROVIDES OUTREACH PROGRAMS AT THE LOCAL AND NATIONAL LEVEL.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: RESEARCH - PHA PROVIDES PEER-REVIEWED GRANT AWARDS FOR PH RESEARCH THROUGH TWO PROGRAMS. THE PARTNERSHIP WITH NIH/NHLBI LEVERAGES ADDITIONAL FUNDS FOR RESEARCH.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ASSOCIATION'S ENDOWMENT FUNDS INTENDED USES ARE TO PROVIDE: SCHOLARSHIPS FOR PATIENTS AND CAREGIVERS TO ATTEND THE ASSOCIATION'S CONFERENCES AND MEETINGS; MENTORED CLINICAL SCIENTIST DEVELOPMENT AWARD; AND, FINANCIAL SUPPORT FOR THE PHA SUPPORT GROUP LEADERSHIP INSTITUTE.

THE ASSOCIATION QUALIFIES AS A TAX-EXEMPT ORGANIZATION UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE AND IS NOT SUBJECT TO INCOME TAXES EXCEPT FOR INCOME FROM ITS UNRELATED BUSINESS ACTIVITIES. THERE IS NO PROVISION FOR INCOME TAXES AS THE ASSOCIATION HAD NO UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME FOR THE YEAR ENDED DECEMBER 31, 2015. IN ACCORDANCE WITH U.S. GENERALLY ACCEPTED ACCOUNTING PRINCIPLES, THE ASSOCIATION HAS EVALUATED THEIR TAX POSITION FOR THE YEAR ENDED DECEMBER 31, 2015 AND HAS DETERMINED THAT THEY QUALIFY AS A TAX-EXEMPT ORGANIZATION. AS OF DECEMBER 31, 2015, THE STATUTE OF LIMITATIONS FOR TAX YEARS 2012 THROUGH 2014 REMAINS OPEN WITH INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE.

FundraisingEventInformationGrp.Event1Nm: PA HOPE FOR A CURE GALA

RecipientBusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: TRUSTEES OF THE UNIVERSITY OF PENNSYLVANIA

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: SOME EMERITUS TRUSTEES HAVE A FAMILY RELATIONSHIP WITH ONE ANOTHER, BUT DO NOT HAVE VOTING RIGHTS. PAT PATON AND JUDY SIMPSON ARE SISTERS AND FOUNDING DIRECTORS OF PHA.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: PULMONARY HYPERTENSION ASSOCIATION IS A MEMBERSHIP ORGANIZATION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: WE SET A SPECIAL MEETING (VIA CONFERENCE CALL) FOR OUR AUDIT COMMITTEE TO REVIEW IT WITH THE CPA FIRM THAT CONDUCTS OUR ANNUAL AUDIT AND PREPARES FORM 990.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: DIRECTORS ARE REQUIRED TO SUBMIT A CONFLICT OF INTEREST DISCLOSURE STATEMENT ON AN ANNUAL BASIS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE COMPARES THE PRESIDENT'S COMPENSATION TO COMPENSATION AT SEVEN OTHER COMPARABLE ORGANIZATIONS BEFORE MAKING THE ANNUAL ADJUSTMENT.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: OUR FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC ON OUR WEBSITE, THROUGH CHARITY NAVIGATOR, AND BY REQUEST.
